item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, October 27, 2024 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. A Chopin waltz unearthed after nearly 200 years (189 points | 56 comments)
2. You-get: Dumb downloader that scrapes the web (124 points | 43 comments)
3. Inside the Transport for London cyberattack (42 points | 4 comments)
4. What is the first American graphic novel? (23 points | 7 comments)

6. Character amnesia in China (98 points | 67 comments)
7. NewPipe on Linux, Using Android_translation_layer (8 points | 3 comments)
8. Using less memory to look up IP addresses in Mess With DNS (50 points | 17 comments)
9. Hyperbound (YC S23) is hiring a 4th founding full-stack engineer ( | hide)
10. 'Visual clutter' alters information flow in the brain (80 points | 26 comments)
11. SDL-based Lua programming environment for kids similar to Codea (24 points | 11 comments)
12. School is Not Enough: Learning is a consequence of doing (91 points | 36 comments)
13. The Prophet of Cyberspace (2016) (46 points | 7 comments)
14. Amphion: An open-source audio, music, and speech generation toolkit (59 points | 1 comment)
15. ModelKit: Transforming AI/ML artifact sharing and management across lifecycles (5 points | 1 comment)
16. Highest-Voltage Electron Gun (19 points | 23 comments)

19. Typeset: An HTML pre-proces­sor for web ty­pog­ra­phy (103 points | 48 comments)
20. How 'Factorio' seduced Silicon Valley and me (343 points | 370 comments)
21. In some scientific papers, words expressing uncertainty have decreased (2023) (5 points | discuss)
22. Understanding Round Robin DNS (356 points | 110 comments)
23. How fast can you parse a CSV file in C#? (5 points | 1 comment)
24. James Webb Telescope discovers some quasars that seem to exist in isolation (134 points | 51 comments)
25. I've never used cohost but I miss it (48 points | 24 comments)
26. Controllable Fast and Slow Thinking by Learning with Randomized Reasoning Traces (3 points | 1 comment)
27. Saturated fat: the making and unmaking of a scientific consensus (2022) (112 points | 185 comments)
28. Writes and Write-Nots (141 points | 125 comments)
29. Using LLMs to enhance our testing practices (166 points | 66 comments)
30. How the human brain contends with the strangeness of zero (53 points | 74 comments)
